edu.iastate.cs228.game
Interface Agent

public interface Agent

The main Agent interface you must implement.
All Agent-implementing classes must have a default constructor (no parameters). You may assume setColor() and setOpponentColor() are called only once and before your Agent is used - these would be parameters for your constructor, but for technical reasons, this cannot be done.

This method must return your agent's name (of your choosing).

Returns:

getAgentImage

File getAgentImage()
Function to retrieve your image file (assuming it is present at the base level of your project).

Returns:
the agent's image file (if you wish to make a 128x128 icon for your agent) or null (to use the default image)

inTournament

boolean inTournament()
Whether your agent is a candidate for the tournament. Return true if this agent is submitted for the tournament, false otherwise.

Returns:
true iff you wish to enter this agent in the tournament

getCommandTurnTournament

Agent.AgentAction[] getCommandTurnTournament(GalaxyState g,
                                             int energyLevel)
Function used to generate command turns from your agent. Use the passed GalaxyState to decide 3 actions for your agent. This version will only be used if this agent is run during a tournament.

Parameters:
g - a scan of the current state of the system
energyLevel - energy level corresponding to the amount of energy the agent has
Returns:
an array of 3 AgentActions that indicates the agent's next 3 actions if in a tournament situation. If fewer than 3 actions are specified or there are null actions, these agent moves are lost.

getCommandTurnGrading

Agent.AgentAction[] getCommandTurnGrading(GalaxyState g,
                                          int energyLevel)
Function used to generate command turns from your agent. Use the passed GalaxyState to decide 3 actions for your agent. This version will only be used if this agent is run during grading.

Parameters:
g - a scan of the current state of the system
energyLevel - energy level corresponding to the amount of energy the agent has
Returns:
An array of 3 AgentActions that indicates the agent’s next 3 actions if in an exhibition/grading situation. If fewer than 3 actions are specified or there are null actions, these agent moves are lost.

setColor

void setColor(Color c)
Allow the simulation to set the color of your agent. It's up to you to save this information somehow. This method is called only once, at the start of each simulation.

Parameters:
c - color your agent will appear as

setOpponentColor

void setOpponentColor(Color c)
Allow the simulation to set the color of your agent's opponent. It's up to you to save this information if you need it. This method is called only once, at the start of each simulation.

Parameters:
c - color of your agent's opponent
